trailingComments.value:
*
Represents a slice of the `subTokens` of some {@link Group}.
This is just a view of it, so taking e.g. {@link tail} is O(1).
Most parser functions act on a Slice and call other functions on sub-slices.
* @private

leadingComments.value: * @private

trailingComments.value: * Number of tokens.

leadingComments.value: * Number of tokens.

trailingComments.value: * True iff there are no tokens left.

leadingComments.value: * True iff there are no tokens left.

trailingComments.value: For these methods, caller must ensure non-empty.
* First token.

leadingComments.value: For these methods, caller must ensure non-empty.
* First token.

trailingComments.value: * Slice of first token.

leadingComments.value: * Slice of first token.

trailingComments.value: * Second token.

leadingComments.value: * Second token.

trailingComments.value: * Last token.

leadingComments.value: * Last token.

trailingComments.value: * Second-to-last token.

leadingComments.value: * Second-to-last token.

trailingComments.value: * Slice of all but the first token.

leadingComments.value: * Slice of all but the first token.

trailingComments.value: * Slice of all but the last token.

leadingComments.value: * Slice of all but the last token.

trailingComments.value: * Iterate over every Token.

*
	Iterator over a Slice for every Token.
	Assumes every sub-token is a Slice too; meaning this is a {@link Group.Block} slice.

leadingComments.value:

	Iterator over a Slice for every Token.
	Assumes every sub-token is a Slice too; meaning this is a {@link Group.Block} slice.

trailingComments.value: * Maps over a Slice for every Token, as in {@link slices}.

leadingComments.value: * Maps over a Slice for every Token, as in {@link slices}.

*
Represents a slice of the `subTokens` of some {@link Group}.
This is just a view of it, so taking e.g. {@link tail} is O(1).
Most parser functions act on a Slice and call other functions on sub-slices.

comments.value:
*
Represents a slice of the `subTokens` of some {@link Group}.
This is just a view of it, so taking e.g. {@link tail} is O(1).
Most parser functions act on a Slice and call other functions on sub-slices.
* @private
* Number of tokens.
* True iff there are no tokens left.
For these methods, caller must ensure non-empty.
* First token.
* Slice of first token.
* Second token.
* Last token.
* Second-to-last token.
* Slice of all but the first token.
* Slice of all but the last token.
* Iterate over every Token.

*
	Iterator over a Slice for every Token.
	Assumes every sub-token is a Slice too; meaning this is a {@link Group.Block} slice.
* Maps over a Slice for every Token, as in {@link slices}.
